name: K2-63
scenarioDescription:
The K2-63 Exoplanetary System

K2-63 is a star with 1.4 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.63 times its radius. It is located 1710.39 light years away from the solar system.

K2-63 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-63 b

K2-63 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.26 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-63.

The mass of K2-63 b is 15.89 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-63 b is 3.22 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-63 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

K2-63 c

K2-63 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 25.46 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-63.

The mass of K2-63 c is 25.23 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-63 c is 3.9 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-63 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-63, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by K2.
